moves.1. f4: Annotations start at move 24 as I'm discussing rook ending only.
moves.1... g6 2. e4 Bg7 3. Nc3 d6 4. Nf3 Nf6 5: The best move here in my opinion was Rf3 so that if Black does Bxc3 White will have Rxc3 and then has Rxc6 if Black would do Rxe4.
moves.24... Kg7 25. Kf1: This move is a clear blunder and serves no purpose to White. White has put his king in the open file. And Black also has the opportunity to capture the Rank 2 and then white king is stuck in the very first file it is standing on. This move is the biggest mistake that cost white's game. Always avoid such position. Never let your opponent to restrict your king in the first rank!!!
moves.26. Rc1: Rg2 was the key move.  White did wrong again!
moves.26... Rf8+: a consequence to putting your king in the wrong file and gave your opponent an opportunity to gain the best position as the Black gets in the next move and captures the Rank 2 and then white king is hapless.
moves.27. Ke1 Rff2 28. Rg5: Rd1 was much much better.  Black would do Rxc2 but white would give check! with Rd7.
moves.28... Bf4 29. Rg4 g5 30. e5 Rdxc2 31. Rx: certainly a blunder. But the game is already lost here. No other move could save white. You could try Rf2 but it would not give white anything either.
